Key Match Events: Corey Seager and Marcus Semien each homered early in an 11-7 rout of the Arizona Diamondbacks in Game 4 on Tuesday night, pushing the Rangers' Series lead to 3-1 and putting them on the brink of a title.
Semien’s three-run homer that put them up 10-0 in the third inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Texas Rangers are favorites to win the World Series at -1700 odds, according to FanDuel Sportsbook.
Post-Match Reflections: Corey Seager could join Sandy Koufax, Bob Gibson and Reggie Jackson as the only two-time World Series MVPs.
Texas improved to 10-0 on the road this postseason and moved within one win of the first title in the 63-season history of a franchise that started as the expansion Washington Senators.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Seager is the first shortstop with three World Series homers, and he has four homers in his last five games dating to the AL Championship Series.
The Rangers and Diamondbacks combined for three errorless games to start this year’s World Series, the first time that’s happened.
Rangers manager Bruce Bochy is trying for his fourth World Series title after winning with San Francisco in 2010, 2012 and 2014.
